H0.text: The nervous and muscle systems are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H1.text: Muscle and endocrine systems are the most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H2.text: The nervous and digestive systems are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H3.text: Reproductive and circulatory are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

A4.text: Stimulation of the receptors activate peripheral sensory neurons that convey signals to the spinal cord that may drive a responsive reflex, and may also be conveyed to the brain for conscious perception.

A5.text: Balance is also mediated by the kinesthetic reflex fed by proprioception (which senses the relative location of the rest of the body to the head).
